skill.name: goal-setter
skill.description: Transform objectives into structured goals with plans. Use when user declares intent ("I want to...", "Goal is to...", "Achieve X by Y"). Decomposes into subgoals, milestones, success criteria.
skill.summary: Transform objectives into structured goals with plans. Use when user declares intent ("I want to..."...
skill.author: BellaBe

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only AI instructions and process documentation. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or external commands. All 94 static findings are false positives caused by markdown formatting (backticks), documentation file path references, and keyword misclassification. The skill only reads and writes markdown files within the project directory.

content.user_title: Transform objectives into structured goals with plans
content.value_statement: Users struggle to break vague intentions into actionable plans. This skill decomposes any objective into subgoals, milestones, and measurable success criteria. It ensures goals are specific, time-bound, and aligned with your strategic context.
actual_capabilities: Decompose vague objectives into 3-5 actionable subgoals
Define measurable success criteria for each goal
Set autonomy levels (auto, ask, hybrid) for execution
Link goals to strategic canvas assumptions
limitations: Requires user to provide deadline and success criteria context
Does not execute tasks or track external project management tools
Does not integrate with calendars or reminder systems
Requires canvas context files for full functionality

use_cases.title: Set business growth targets
use_cases.description: Transform revenue targets into actionable acquisition, activation, and monetization subgoals

use_cases.title: Ship feature releases
use_cases.description: Break down product launches into development, testing, and launch milestones

use_cases.title: Build brand presence
use_cases.description: Create structured plans for audience growth and thought leadership campaigns

prompt_templates.title: Simple business goal
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to reach $100K ARR by end of year.

prompt_templates.title: Product launch goal
prompt_templates.prompt: Goal: Ship the mobile app by Q2. We have two developers and the core workflow is defined.

prompt_templates.title: Brand awareness goal
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to build my LinkedIn presence for thought leadership targeting technical founders.

prompt_templates.title: Full context goal
prompt_templates.prompt: Transform this objective into a structured goal: Achieve product-market fit with our B2B SaaS offering by validating with 20 enterprise customers. Current traction is 5 pilot users. Mode is BOOTSTRAP.

output_examples.input: I want to reach $50K MRR by end of Q2
output: Success Criteria: MRR >= $50K, Profit margin >= 30%, CAC payback < 6 months
Subgoals: Close first 3 paying customers, Validate unit economics, Scale acquisition
Milestones: M1 by mid-March, M2 by end-April, M3 by mid-May, M4 by end-June
Links to Canvas: Pricing model, Cost structure, Revenue assumptions

output_examples.input: Ship the mobile app by Q1
output: Success Criteria: App in stores, 100 beta users, less than 1% crash rate
Subgoals: Core features complete, Beta testing, Store submission
Milestones: M1 feature freeze, M2 beta release, M3 app store submission, M4 launch
Links to Canvas: Solution scope, Problem statement, User constraints

best_practices: Provide specific numbers and deadlines when stating objectives
Specify whether you are in VENTURE or BOOTSTRAP mode for business goals
Review existing goals first to avoid duplication
anti_patterns: Setting goals without deadlines or measurable outcomes
Skipping the clarification questions when objectives are vague
Setting autonomy to auto for high-impact decisions

faq.question: What tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires file system access to read canvas context.

faq.question: How many subgoals does it create?
faq.answer: Typically creates 3-5 subgoals based on decomposition of the objective and strategic context.

faq.question: Does it integrate with external tools?
faq.answer: No. It creates markdown goal files locally and works within the LeanOS operating system.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads and writes markdown files in your strategy directory. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: What if my goal is too vague?
faq.answer: The skill will ask clarifying questions about success criteria, timeline, and constraints before creating the goal.

faq.question: How is this different from task managers?
faq.answer: It focuses on strategic goal decomposition with success criteria, not task tracking. Goals link to strategic assumptions.
